data.PS: The following links are only valid for module list maintainers:
data.rationale:
GNU Arch is a revision control system, and arch-perl is a Perl
    interface to GNU Arch. I believe Arch:: namespace should be reserved
    for arch-perl project.

    Several distributions (including Debian) already include arch-perl
    as a separate package or a part of archzoom, archway or axp
    packages, that are the main front-ends based on arch-perl.

    [Actually, these front-ends use ArchZoom::, ArchWay:: and AXP::
    namespaces respectivelly, that I'd like to keep too. However these
    are regular unix applications, there are no immediate plans to make
    them installable from CPAN.]

    http://migo.sixbit.org/software/arch-perl/
    http://migo.sixbit.org/software/arch-magic/
